# How to install {% if packageWebsiteConfig.shortName %}{{packageWebsiteConfig.shortName}}{% else %}the {{packageWebsiteConfig.longName}}{% endif %}

{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCustomUserInformation == "true" %}
<CustomInstall nodeVersion={frontMatter.node_version}/>
{% else %}
## Prerequisites

A recent [Node.js](https://nodejs.org) (>=**{{packageEnginesNodeVersion}}**),
since the TypeScript code
is compiled into ECMAScript 2020 code, and the tests use ES6 modules.

## Install

The package is available as
[`{{packageScopedName}}`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/{{packageScopedName}}/)
from the public [`npmjs`](https://www.npmjs.com) repository;
it can be added as a
{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCli != "true" %}dependency to any TypeScript or JavaScript{% else %}development dependency to any **npm**{% endif %}
project with `npm install`:

```console
npm install {{packageScopedName}}@latest --save-dev --verbose
```

{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCli != "true" %}
The package does not provide any executables, and generally there are no
reasons to install it globally.{% else %}
The package does provides executables, and can also
be installed globally.

```console
npm install --location=global {{packageScopedName}}@latest --verbose
```

{% endif %}

## Uninstall

As any **npm** package, it can be uninstalled from the project with:

```console
npm uninstall {{packageScopedName}}
```

{% if packageWebsiteConfig.hasCli == "true" %}
It can also be uninstalled if installed globally:

```console
npm uninstall --location=global {{packageScopedName}}
```

{% endif %}
{% endif %}
